meanings.definition: Relating to the Christian Church or its clergy.
meanings.sent1: The ecclesiastical robes worn by the priest were ornate and ceremonial.
meanings.sent2: The ecclesiastical council met to discuss matters concerning the church.
meanings.sent3: The ecclesiastical cat seemed to enjoy sitting in the church pews during services.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an ecclesiastical quality, commanding attention like a church bell.
meanings.sent5: The ecclesiastical music filled the cathedral, lifting spirits with its divine melody.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a church or its organization.
meanings.sent1: The ecclesiastical architecture of the building reflected centuries of religious history.
meanings.sent2: The ecclesiastical hierarchy determined the structure of power within the church.
meanings.sent3: The ecclesiastical mice seemed to have a preference for the church's pantry.
meanings.sent4: His leadership style was ecclesiastical, guiding his team with a sense of divine purpose.
meanings.sent5: The ecclesiastical bells rang out, marking the start of the religious procession.
